#Text=Ireland votes to overturn 35-year-old constitutional ban on abortion
#Text=Sunday , May 27 , 2018

#Text=In the official result of Friday 's Irish referendum over the legality of abortion , referendum officer Barry Ryan announced yesterday 66.4 % of voters favoured overturning the eighth amendment of the constitution .
#Text=Introduced in 1983 , the eighth amendment made abortion constitutionally illegal .
#Text=Irish Taoiseach — Prime Minister — Leo Varadkar said supporting legislation , to be framed following the result of this referendum , is to be " enacted before the end of this year " .
#Text=66.4 % ( represented in green ) citizens voted to repeal the 8th amendment , while 33.6 % voted in favour of anti-abortion law .
#Text=Turnout : 64.1 %
#Text=Image : acagastya .
#Text=( CC BY 2.5 )
#Text=More than 2.1 million people voted on the referendum on Friday .
#Text=With a 64.1 % turnout , 1,429,981 voted in favour of eliminating the abortion ban while 723,632 voted to keep it .
#Text=The results were announced at Dublin Castle .
#Text=About 6000 voters spoiled their votes .
#Text=Calling it " an historic day " , Prime Minister Varadkar said it was " a great act of democracy . "
#Text=Ministers said they would form laws allowing medical termination of pregnancy in the first trimester , twelve weeks , of pregnancy , and under special cases until the 24th week .
#Text=The legislation is to be formed after discussion with medical experts .
#Text=Percentage who voted ' Yes ' to overturn the eighth amendment , per constituencyImage : acagastya .
#Text=( CC BY 4.0 )

#Text=Since the amendment , Article 40.3.3 of the Irish constitution , in 1983 , which gave an unborn child equal rights to life as the mother , hundreds of thousands of women traveled to different countries for the medical termination of pregnancy , while some used medical drugs illegal in Ireland to terminate the pregnancy .
#Text=" Savita Matters , Women Matter " was one of the slogans used by the supporters who wanted to repeal the amendment .
#Text=In October 2012 , a 31-year-old dentist of Indian origin , Savita Halappanavar , died from sepsis at a Galway hospital after she was denied abortion for a protracted miscarriage .
#Text=She was told by a midwife that termination of pregnancy would not be possible since Ireland was a " Catholic country " .
#Text=Halappanavar 's photo was used for posters by supporters who wanted the 35-year-old amendment repealed .
#Text=In 2016 , the current Roman Catholic Pope , Pope Francis , described abortion as a " very grave sin " and a " horrendous crime " .
#Text=Halappanavar 's father Andanappa Yalagi told Hindustan Times , " We 've got justice for Savita .

#Text=I have no words to express my gratitude to the people of Ireland at this historic moment .

column1: #Text=" I will accept the will of the Irish people , at the same time I will make it very clear what I feel of the campaign that has taken place .

#Text=Another activist , David Quinn , said ,  The result today is basically a reversal of the 1983 result .

_	_	_	_

#Text= The people have said that we want a modern constitution for a modern country " , Prime Minister Varadkar said .

column1: #Text=Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau later congratulated Varadkar on Twitter , saying : " What a moment for democracy and women 's rights . "
